info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 10:22PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Christian and south central Sangamon Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1022 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pawnee, or 9 miles northeast of Virden, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kincaid, Bulpitt and Jeisyville around 1040 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Taylorville. This includes Interstate 55 between mile markers 77 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central Illinois.
